title: Is Bernie Sanders qualified enough to run for president? - Quora
tags: Presidents of the United States of America

response.answer_text: Not by Republican standards. Nearly all his work experience has been in government, which is worthless according to them. He has no business experience, which is how to run a government—just like a business, for personal profit, like the Republicans’ choice does. Sanders has no experience conning people out of their money—bankers, investors, employees, suppliers, contractors, and customers, unlike the Republicans’ Man of the Hour. He isn’t a real man, because he doesn’t have over sixty women accusing him of sexually assaulting and/or harassing them (and then bragging about it), unlike the Republicans’ choice. He doesn’t realize that people are only poor because they’re lazy; that Mexicans are rapists; that you should never rent an apartment to a black family; that chain immigration is evil and close to treason (unless it’s your latest wife’s family of course); that the press (other than Fox “News”, Breitbart and such) is evil and unamerican and lies all the time—as proven by their claiming that Trump lies all the time, and then showing communist things like “facts” and “videos” of what he said to prove it). He’s never been repeatedly bailed out by his dad because his business ventures have a habit of going bankrupt, and then being bailed out by the Russian mob—so he also doesn’t understand the Art of the Deal (i.e. have a rich dad and crooked business associates who need a money launderer who asks no inconvenient questions). So by Republican standards, Sanders doesn’t have what they’re looking for. But fear not. He isn’t going to be the Democratic nominee anyway, so his qualifications-or lack of them—are irrelevant. And the guy who will be the Democratic nominee is infinitely more qualified than the other party’s candidate, by experience, by temperament, and by sheer human decency.

See, here’s one of the things about America, in its politics, qualifications don’t matter. As long as you fulfill the minuscule constitutional requirement to be President, if you can get elected, you are qualified according to the system. Note that the other answerer’s statements about him being a socialist is not an answer about his qualifications, merely their opinions of his opinions. Do not be duped into conflating the two. Ah but I get what you’re asking, has Sanders got the base of knowledge that might enable him to be successful in office? Well lets see, he’s been in Congress for decades, in politics for longer, was a marcher for Civil Rights and against the imperialist butchering of Vietnam in the 60s and 70s, has a decades long reputation for integrity in Vermont and one of the highest name recognitions of any serving politician nationally. He’s also pretty much single-handedly shifted the window of acceptable political discussion in the US further to the left, enabling open discussion of some things that would be almost unthinkable before. He probably forgets more about how Congress and law-making work then most people will ever learn. I’d wager he’s more qualified then most members of the current establishment, including the current President. That won’t stop the smear campaign which answers questions like this with irrelevant attacks on his character like some other answers on this side, but that was going to happen anyway.
